articles.title: Frases en H√∫ngaro para Pedir y Ofrecer Perd√≥n a tu Pareja
articles.content:
Los h√∫ngaros valoran la sinceridad profunda al pedir perd√≥n. Estas frases te ayudar√°n.

## Frases para Pedir Perd√≥n

### "Nagyon sajn√°lom"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** NA-dyon SHAY-na-lom

**Significado:** Lo siento mucho

### "K√©rlek, bocs√°ss meg"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** KER-lek BO-chash meg

**Significado:** Por favor, perd√≥name

### "Tudom, hogy megb√°ntottalak, √©s m√©lyen sajn√°lom"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** TU-dom hody meg-BAN-to-ta-lak esh ME-lyen SHAY-na-lom

**Significado:** S√© que te her√≠, y lo lamento profundamente

### "Hib√°ztam"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** HI-baz-tam

**Significado:** Me equivoqu√©

### "Hogyan tehetem j√≥v√°?"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** HO-dyan TE-he-tem YO-va

**Significado:** ¬øC√≥mo puedo arreglarlo?

### "Meg√≠g√©rem, hogy nem fordul el≈ë √∫jra"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** meg-I-ge-rem hody nem FOR-dul e-L√ñ UY-ra

**Significado:** Prometo que no volver√° a pasar

## Frases para Ofrecer Perd√≥n

### "Megbocs√°tok"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** meg-BO-cha-tok

**Significado:** Te perdono

### "Hagyjuk ezt magunk m√∂g√∂tt"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** HADY-yuk est MA-gunk m√∂-G√ñTT

**Significado:** Dejemos esto atr√°s

### "K√©szen √°llok tov√°bbl√©pni"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** KE-sen A-lok to-VAB-lep-ni

**Significado:** Estoy listo/a para seguir adelante

### "Mindenki hib√°zik"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** MIN-den-ki HI-ba-zik

**Significado:** Todos cometemos errores

### "M√©g mindig szeretlek"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** Meg MIN-dig SE-ret-lek

**Significado:** Todav√≠a te amo

## Conclusi√≥n

La sinceridad profunda es clave al pedir perd√≥n en h√∫ngaro.

articles.title: √ént√¢lnirea cu Familia: Fraze Turce»ôti Esen»õiale
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

UrmeazƒÉ sƒÉ cuno»ôti familia turcƒÉ a partenerului? Familia este EXTREM de importantƒÉ √Æn cultura turcƒÉ! Cu frazele »ôi sfaturile potrivite, vei face o impresie excelentƒÉ.

## Prima √ént√¢lnire

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Memnun oldum"
  translation="√énc√¢ntat de cuno»ôtin»õƒÉ"
  pronunciation="mem-NOON ol-DOOM"
  context="Salutul formal perfect pentru prima √Ænt√¢lnire cu familia!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Merhaba, ben..."
  translation="BunƒÉ ziua, eu sunt..."
  pronunciation="mehr-HA-ba ben"
  example="Merhaba, ben Maria. Tanƒ±≈ütƒ±ƒüƒ±mƒ±za memnun oldum."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sizinle tanƒ±≈ümak b√ºy√ºk bir onur"
  translation="Este o mare onoare sƒÉ vƒÉ cunosc"
  pronunciation="si-zin-LEH ta-nuhsh-MAK boo-YOOK bir o-NOOR"
  example="Sizinle tanƒ±≈ümak b√ºy√ºk bir onur, efendim."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="[Partner] sizden √ßok bahsetti"
  translation="[Partner] mi-a povestit mult despre dumneavoastrƒÉ"
  pronunciation="siz-DEN chok bah-SET-ti"
  example="Ahmet sizden √ßok bahsetti, hep g√ºzel ≈üeyler!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Siz vs. Sen" flag="üáπüá∑">
Folose»ôte √éNTOTDEAUNA "siz" (dumneavoastrƒÉ) cu pƒÉrin»õii partenerului! Este un semn de respect fundamental. Ei te vor invita sƒÉ folose»ôti "sen" c√¢nd vor fi pregƒÉti»õi.
</CultureTip>

## Prezentarea Ta

<VocabCard
  word="Romanya'dan geliyorum"
  translation="Vin din Rom√¢nia"
  pronunciation="ro-MAN-ya-dan geh-li-YO-room"
  example="Ben Romanya'dan geliyorum, B√ºkre≈ü'ten."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="... olarak √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±yorum"
  translation="Lucrez ca..."
  pronunciation="o-la-RAK cha-luh-shuh-YO-room"
  example="M√ºhendis olarak √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±yorum."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Biz ... tanƒ±≈ütƒ±k"
  translation="Ne-am cunoscut la/√Æn..."
  pronunciation="biz ta-nuhsh-TUHK"
  example="Biz i≈üte tanƒ±≈ütƒ±k, iki yƒ±l √∂nce."
/>

| Situa»õie | TurcƒÉ | Rom√¢nƒÉ |
|----------|-------|--------|
| La muncƒÉ | i≈üte | la muncƒÉ |
| La universitate | √ºniversitede | la universitate |
| Prin prieteni | arkada≈ülar aracƒ±lƒ±ƒüƒ±yla | prin prieteni |
| Online | internette | online |
| √én cƒÉlƒÉtorie | seyahatte | √Æn cƒÉlƒÉtorie |

## Membrii Familiei

<VocabCard
  word="kayƒ±nvalide / kaynana"
  translation="soacrƒÉ"
  pronunciation="ka-yuhn-va-li-DEH / kai-na-NA"
  example="Kayƒ±nvalidem √ßok iyi yemek yapƒ±yor."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="kayƒ±npeder / kaynata"
  translation="socru"
  pronunciation="ka-yuhn-peh-DER / kai-na-TA"
  example="Kayƒ±npederim √ßok bilgili bir adam."
/>

| TurcƒÉ | Rom√¢nƒÉ |
|-------|--------|
| kayƒ±nvalide | soacrƒÉ |
| kayƒ±npeder | socru |
| anne | mamƒÉ |
| baba | tatƒÉ |
| abla | sorƒÉ mai mare |
| aƒüabey | frate mai mare |
| karde≈ü | frate/sorƒÉ |
| gelin | norƒÉ |
| damat | ginere |
| anneanne | bunicƒÉ (din partea mamei) |
| babaanne | bunicƒÉ (din partea tatƒÉlui) |
| dede | bunic |

<CultureTip title="Anne »ôi Baba" flag="üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß">
√én familiile turce»ôti apropiate, partenerul tƒÉu s-ar putea sƒÉ se adreseze pƒÉrin»õilor tƒÉi cu "anne" (mamƒÉ) »ôi "baba" (tatƒÉ), »ôi invers. E un semn de acceptare √Æn familie!
</CultureTip>

## Conversa»õii Politicoase

<VocabCard
  word="Nasƒ±lsƒ±nƒ±z?"
  translation="Ce mai face»õi?"
  pronunciation="na-suhl-suh-NUHZ"
  example="Merhaba! Nasƒ±lsƒ±nƒ±z?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Eviniz √ßok g√ºzel"
  translation="Casa dumneavoastrƒÉ e foarte frumoasƒÉ"
  pronunciation="eh-vi-NIZ chok goo-ZEL"
  example="Eviniz √ßok g√ºzel! √áok sƒ±cak bir ortam."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Bah√ßeniz muhte≈üem!"
  translation="GrƒÉdina dumneavoastrƒÉ e magnificƒÉ!"
  pronunciation="bah-cheh-NIZ mooh-teh-SHEM"
  example="Bah√ßeniz muhte≈üem! Siz mi bakƒ±yorsunuz?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Yardƒ±m edebilir miyim?"
  translation="Pot sƒÉ vƒÉ ajut?"
  pronunciation="yar-DUHM eh-deh-bi-LIR mi-YIM"
  example="Mutfakta yardƒ±m edebilir miyim?"
/>

## La MasƒÉ

<VocabCard
  word="√áok g√ºzel g√∂r√ºn√ºyor!"
  translation="AratƒÉ foarte bine!"
  pronunciation="chok goo-ZEL gur-oo-noo-YOR"
  example="Vay, √ßok g√ºzel g√∂r√ºn√ºyor! Te≈üekk√ºrler."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="√áok lezzetli"
  translation="E foarte gustos"
  pronunciation="chok lez-zet-LI"
  example="√áok lezzetli! Elinize saƒülƒ±k!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Elinize saƒülƒ±k"
  translation="SƒÉnƒÉtate m√¢inilor dumneavoastrƒÉ"
  pronunciation="eh-li-ni-ZEH sa-LUHK"
  example="√áok lezzetli, elinize saƒülƒ±k!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Afiyet olsun!"
  translation="PoftƒÉ bunƒÉ!"
  pronunciation="a-fi-YET ol-SOON"
  example="Afiyet olsun herkese!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Elinize Saƒülƒ±k" flag="üçΩÔ∏è">
"Elinize saƒülƒ±k" (sƒÉnƒÉtate m√¢inilor) este complimentul suprem pentru cel care a gƒÉtit. Spune-l √éNTOTDEAUNA dupƒÉ masƒÉ - e foarte apreciat!
</CultureTip>

## Oferirea Complimentelor

<VocabCard
  word="Harika yemek yapƒ±yorsunuz"
  translation="GƒÉti»õi minunat"
  pronunciation="ha-RI-ka yeh-MEK ya-puh-YOR-soo-NOOZ"
  example="Ger√ßekten harika yemek yapƒ±yorsunuz!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="√áok g√ºzel bir aileniz var"
  translation="Ave»õi o familie foarte frumoasƒÉ"
  pronunciation="chok goo-ZEL bir ai-leh-NIZ var"
  example="√áok g√ºzel bir aileniz var. Kendimi evimde gibi hissediyorum."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="[Partner] b√∂yle bir aileden geldiƒüi i√ßin ≈üanslƒ±"
  translation="[Partner] are noroc cƒÉ provine dintr-o astfel de familie"
  pronunciation="buy-LEH bir ai-leh-DEN gel-di-I i-CHIN shan-SLUH"
  example="Ahmet b√∂yle g√ºzel bir aileden geldiƒüi i√ßin √ßok ≈üanslƒ±."
/>

## ArƒÉtarea Interesului

<VocabCard
  word="Daha fazla anlatƒ±r mƒ±sƒ±nƒ±z?"
  translation="Pute»õi povesti mai mult?"
  pronunciation="DA-ha faz-LA an-la-TUHR muh-suh-NUHZ"
  example="√áok ilgin√ß! Daha fazla anlatƒ±r mƒ±sƒ±nƒ±z?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Nasƒ±l tanƒ±≈ütƒ±nƒ±z?"
  translation="Cum v-a»õi cunoscut?"
  pronunciation="na-SUHL ta-nuhsh-tuh-NUHZ"
  example="Sorabilir miyim, nasƒ±l tanƒ±≈ütƒ±nƒ±z?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Bu √ßok ilgin√ß"
  translation="Aceasta e foarte interesant"
  pronunciation="boo chok il-GINCH"
  example="Bu √ßok ilgin√ß! Devam edin, l√ºtfen."
/>

## Oferirea de Cadouri

<VocabCard
  word="Size k√º√ß√ºk bir hediye getirdim"
  translation="V-am adus un mic cadou"
  pronunciation="si-ZEH koo-CHOOK bir heh-di-YEH geh-tir-DIM"
  example="Size k√º√ß√ºk bir hediye getirdim, Romanya'dan."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Bu Romanya'dan bir ≈üey"
  translation="Aceasta e ceva din Rom√¢nia"
  pronunciation="boo ro-MAN-ya-dan bir shey"
  example="Buyurun, bu Romanya'dan geleneksel bir ≈üey."
/>

### Idei de Cadouri pentru Familiile Turce»ôti

| Cadou | TurcƒÉ | De Ce E Potrivit |
|-------|-------|------------------|
| CiocolatƒÉ | √ßikolata | To»õi adorƒÉ |
| Flori | √ßi√ßek | Pentru doamne |
| Tatlƒ±/Baklava | tatlƒ± | Dulciuri sunt apreciate |
| Vin/Rakƒ± | ≈üarap/rakƒ± | Depinde de familie |
| Cafea rom√¢neascƒÉ | kahve | Turcii apreciazƒÉ cafeaua |

<CultureTip title="Bayram Ziyareti" flag="üéÅ">
DacƒÉ vizitezi √Æn timpul unei sƒÉrbƒÉtori (bayram), adu neapƒÉrat un cadou! De obicei se aduc ciocolate sau dulciuri. √én zilele de bayram, se sƒÉrutƒÉ m√¢na persoanelor √Æn v√¢rstƒÉ!
</CultureTip>

## Plecarea

<VocabCard
  word="Harika bir ak≈üam i√ßin te≈üekk√ºrler"
  translation="Mul»õumesc pentru o searƒÉ minunatƒÉ"
  pronunciation="ha-RI-ka bir ak-SHAM i-CHIN teh-shek-koor-LER"
  example="Harika bir ak≈üam i√ßin √ßok te≈üekk√ºr ederim!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sizinle tanƒ±≈ümak √ßok g√ºzeldi"
  translation="A fost foarte frumos sƒÉ vƒÉ cunosc"
  pronunciation="si-zin-LEH ta-nuhsh-MAK chok goo-zel-DI"
  example="Sizinle tanƒ±≈ümak ger√ßekten √ßok g√ºzeldi!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Umarƒ±m yakƒ±nda tekrar g√∂r√º≈ü√ºr√ºz"
  translation="Sper sƒÉ ne revedem cur√¢nd"
  pronunciation="oo-ma-RUHM ya-kuhn-DA tek-RAR gur-oo-shoo-ROOZ"
  example="Umarƒ±m yakƒ±nda tekrar g√∂r√º≈ü√ºr√ºz. Belki Romanya'da?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ho≈ü√ßa kalƒ±n, her ≈üey i√ßin te≈üekk√ºrler"
  translation="La revedere, mul»õumesc pentru tot"
  pronunciation="hosh-CHA ka-LUHN her shey i-CHIN teh-shek-koor-LER"
  example="Ho≈ü√ßa kalƒ±n! Her ≈üey i√ßin √ßok te≈üekk√ºr ederim!"
/>


## Ce SƒÉ Faci »ôi Ce SƒÉ Nu Faci

### Ce SƒÉ Faci
- Folose»ôte "siz" cu pƒÉrin»õii
- AcceptƒÉ m√¢ncarea »ôi bƒÉutura (cel pu»õin gustƒÉ)
- Spune "Elinize saƒülƒ±k" dupƒÉ masƒÉ
- Adu un cadou
- AratƒÉ respect pentru persoanele √Æn v√¢rstƒÉ
- Scoate-»õi pantofii la intrare

### Ce SƒÉ Nu Faci
- Refuza complet m√¢ncarea (e jignitor)
- Fi prea informal la prima √Ænt√¢lnire
- Discuta politicƒÉ sau religie sensibil
- Critica ceva
- Pleca devreme

<CultureTip title="Misafirperverlik" flag="üíï">
Ospitalitatea turceascƒÉ (misafirperverlik) este legendarƒÉ! Vei fi tratat ca un oaspete de onoare. "Misafir Allah'ƒ±n misafiridir" (Oaspetele e oaspetele lui Dumnezeu) e un proverb turc.
</CultureTip>

## Ghid Rapid

| Situa»õie | FrazƒÉ |
|----------|-------|
| Salut | Merhaba, memnun oldum! |
| Prezentare | Ben ..., Romanya'dan geliyorum |
| Compliment casƒÉ | Eviniz √ßok g√ºzel |
| Compliment m√¢ncare | √áok lezzetli, elinize saƒülƒ±k! |
| Ajutor | Yardƒ±m edebilir miyim? |
| Mul»õumire | √áok te≈üekk√ºr ederim |
| Plecare | Ho≈ü√ßa kalƒ±n, harika bir ak≈üamdƒ± |

<CTA
  text="Vrei sƒÉ fii »ôi mai pregƒÉtit pentru familia turcƒÉ?"
  buttonText="√énva»õƒÉ Mai Multe Fraze pentru Familie"
/>

articles.title: Russian Greetings and Goodbyes for Couples
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Greetings set the tone for every interaction, and in Russian, they carry warmth and meaning. Whether you're waking up next to your partner or saying goodbye before work, these phrases will help you connect in their native language.

## Morning Greetings

<PhraseOfDay
  word="–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–µ —É—Ç—Ä–æ, —Å–æ–ª–Ω—ã—à–∫–æ!"
  translation="Good morning, sunshine!"
  pronunciation="DOB-ra-ye U-tra, SOL-nysh-ka"
  context="The perfect way to greet your partner when you wake up together."
/>

Start each day with love using these morning greetings:

<VocabCard
  word="–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–µ —É—Ç—Ä–æ"
  translation="Good morning"
  pronunciation="DOB-ra-ye U-tra"
  example="–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–µ —É—Ç—Ä–æ! –ö–∞–∫ —Å–ø–∞–ª–æ—Å—å?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–° –¥–æ–±—Ä—ã–º —É—Ç—Ä–æ–º"
  translation="Good morning (literally: with good morning)"
  pronunciation="z DOB-rym U-tram"
  example="–° –¥–æ–±—Ä—ã–º —É—Ç—Ä–æ–º, –ª—é–±–∏–º–∞—è!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç, —Å–æ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤—É—à–∫–∞"
  translation="Hi, sleepyhead"
  pronunciation="pri-VYET, SON-na-ya ga-la-VUSH-ka"
  example="A playful way to wake your partner."
/>

<CultureTip title="The Triple Kiss" flag="üá∑üá∫">
Russians traditionally greet close friends and family with three kisses on alternating cheeks. With your partner, morning greetings often include this sweet tradition - left, right, left!
</CultureTip>

## Casual Daily Greetings

These are your everyday hellos for texting, calling, or seeing each other:

<VocabCard
  word="–ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç"
  translation="Hi / Hey"
  pronunciation="pri-VYET"
  example="–ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç! –ö–∞–∫ –¥–µ–ª–∞?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ó–¥—Ä–∞–≤—Å—Ç–≤—É–π"
  translation="Hello (informal singular)"
  pronunciation="ZDRAS-tvuy"
  example="–ó–¥—Ä–∞–≤—Å—Ç–≤—É–π, –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ–π!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç–∏–∫"
  translation="Hiya (cute/diminutive)"
  pronunciation="pri-VYE-tik"
  example="–ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç–∏–∫, –∑–∞–π—á–∏–∫!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ó–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤–æ"
  translation="Hey (very casual)"
  pronunciation="zda-RO-va"
  example="–ó–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤–æ! –¢—ã –≥–¥–µ?"
/>

<CultureTip title="Formal vs. Informal" flag="üá∑üá∫">
"–ó–¥—Ä–∞–≤—Å—Ç–≤—É–π" is singular informal (for your partner), while "–ó–¥—Ä–∞–≤—Å—Ç–≤—É–π—Ç–µ" (ZDRAS-tvuy-tye) is formal or plural - use this one for your partner's parents! The word literally means "be healthy."
</CultureTip>

## Afternoon and Evening Greetings

<VocabCard
  word="–î–æ–±—Ä—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å"
  translation="Good afternoon / Good day"
  pronunciation="DOB-ry dyen"
  example="–î–æ–±—Ä—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å! –ö–∞–∫ —Ç–≤–æ–π –¥–µ–Ω—å?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–î–æ–±—Ä—ã–π –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä"
  translation="Good evening"
  pronunciation="DOB-ry VYE-cher"
  example="–î–æ–±—Ä—ã–π –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä, –ª—é–±–∏–º—ã–π!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç, —è –¥–æ–º–∞!"
  translation="Hi, I'm home!"
  pronunciation="pri-VYET, ya DO-ma"
  example="What to say when you walk through the door."
/>

## Asking "How Are You?"

After greeting, it's natural to ask how your partner is doing:

<VocabCard
  word="–ö–∞–∫ –¥–µ–ª–∞?"
  translation="How are you? / How's it going?"
  pronunciation="kak dye-LA"
  example="–ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç, –∫–∞–∫ –¥–µ–ª–∞?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ö–∞–∫ —Ç—ã?"
  translation="How are you? (more personal)"
  pronunciation="kak TY"
  example="–ö–∞–∫ —Ç—ã —Å–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è, –º–∏–ª–∞—è?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ö–∞–∫ —Ç–≤–æ—ë –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∏–µ?"
  translation="How's your mood?"
  pronunciation="kak tva-YO nas-tra-YE-ni-ye"
  example="–ö–∞–∫ —Ç–≤–æ—ë –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ö–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–æ—à—ë–ª –¥–µ–Ω—å?"
  translation="How was your day?"
  pronunciation="kak pra-SHOL dyen"
  example="–†–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–π, –∫–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–æ—à—ë–ª –¥–µ–Ω—å?"
/>

### Common Responses

| Russian | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| –•–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ | kha-ra-SHO | Good |
| –û—Ç–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ | at-LICH-na | Great/Excellent |
| –ù–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ | nar-MAL-na | Fine/Normal |
| –¢–∞–∫ —Å–µ–±–µ | tak se-BYE | So-so |
| –£—Å—Ç–∞–ª(–∞) | us-TAL / us-TA-la | Tired (m/f) |
| –°–∫—É—á–∞—é –ø–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ | sku-CHA-yu pa te-BYE | I miss you |

## Saying Goodbye

<VocabCard
  word="–ü–æ–∫–∞"
  translation="Bye (casual)"
  pronunciation="pa-KA"
  example="–ü–æ–∫–∞, –ª—é–±–∏–º—ã–π! –î–æ –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä–∞!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–î–æ —Å–≤–∏–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è"
  translation="Goodbye (formal)"
  pronunciation="da svi-DA-ni-ya"
  example="–î–æ —Å–≤–∏–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è! –•–æ—Ä–æ—à–µ–≥–æ –¥–Ω—è!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–î–æ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ"
  translation="See you soon"
  pronunciation="da SKO-ra-va"
  example="–î–æ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ, —Å–æ–ª–Ω—ã—à–∫–æ!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–î–æ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏"
  translation="Until we meet"
  pronunciation="da VSTRE-chi"
  example="–î–æ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏ –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä–æ–º!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–£–≤–∏–¥–∏–º—Å—è"
  translation="See you"
  pronunciation="u-VI-dim-sya"
  example="–£–≤–∏–¥–∏–º—Å—è –ø–æ–∑–∂–µ!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Never Over the Threshold" flag="üá∑üá∫">
Russians have a superstition about not greeting or saying goodbye across a threshold (doorway). Always step inside or outside before exchanging greetings - it's considered bad luck otherwise!
</CultureTip>

## Romantic Goodbyes

When parting from your loved one, add extra sweetness:

<VocabCard
  word="–¶–µ–ª—É—é —Ç–µ–±—è"
  translation="I kiss you"
  pronunciation="tse-LU-yu te-BYA"
  example="–ü–æ–∫–∞, —Ü–µ–ª—É—é —Ç–µ–±—è!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–û–±–Ω–∏–º–∞—é –∫—Ä–µ–ø–∫–æ"

  pronunciation="ab-ni-MA-yu KREP-ka"
  example="–û–±–Ω–∏–º–∞—é –∫—Ä–µ–ø–∫–æ, –¥–æ –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä–∞!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ë—É–¥—É —Å–∫—É—á–∞—Ç—å"
  translation="I'll miss you"
  pronunciation="BU-du sku-CHAT"
  example="–ë—É–¥—É —Å–∫—É—á–∞—Ç—å, –ª—é–±–∏–º–∞—è."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–î—É–º–∞–π –æ–±–æ –º–Ω–µ"

  pronunciation="DU-may a-ba MNYE"
  example="–î—É–º–∞–π –æ–±–æ –º–Ω–µ, —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ?"

## Goodnight Phrases

End the day with these tender expressions:

<VocabCard
  word="–°–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ–π –Ω–æ—á–∏"
  translation="Good night"
  pronunciation="spa-KOY-nay NO-chi"
  example="–°–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ–π –Ω–æ—á–∏, –ª—é–±–∏–º—ã–π!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–°–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏—Ö —Å–Ω–æ–≤"
  translation="Sweet dreams"
  pronunciation="SLAT-kikh snov"
  example="–°–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏—Ö —Å–Ω–æ–≤, —Å–æ–ª–Ω—ã—à–∫–æ!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ü—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–Ω–æ–≤"
  translation="Pleasant dreams"
  pronunciation="pri-YAT-nykh snov"
  example="–ü—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–Ω–æ–≤, –º–æ—è –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–î–æ –∑–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞"
  translation="Until tomorrow"
  pronunciation="da ZAV-tra"
  example="–°–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ–π –Ω–æ—á–∏, –¥–æ –∑–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–£–≤–∏–¥–∏–º—Å—è –≤–æ —Å–Ω–µ"
  translation="See you in my dreams"
  pronunciation="u-VI-dim-sya va SNYE"
  example="–£–≤–∏–¥–∏–º—Å—è –≤–æ —Å–Ω–µ, –ª—é–±–∏–º–∞—è."
/>

<CultureTip title="Bedtime Traditions" flag="üá∑üá∫">
Many Russian couples have a tradition of saying "–°–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ–π –Ω–æ—á–∏, —Å–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏—Ö —Å–Ω–æ–≤, —Ü–µ–ª—É—é" (Good night, sweet dreams, kiss) every night before sleep - whether together or apart. It's a comforting ritual that strengthens connection.
</CultureTip>

| –ñ–¥—É —Ç–µ–±—è | zhdu te-BYA | Waiting for you |
